Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Monsignor Kevin Sullivan, Executive Director of Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of New York.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Kallos.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Monsignor Kevin Sullivan, Executive Director of Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of New York.



Council Member Kallos moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Treyger moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 19, 2016 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Resolution approving an exemption from real property taxes for property located at (Block 3519, Lots 1, 5, 12, 20, 30, 34, 42 and 49) the Bronx, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 333).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 333 - Academy Gardens, Bronx

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to introduce and pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would eliminate the exemption of private investment fund carried interest from the New York city unincorporated business tax
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following three Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Borelli, Ulrich, and Matteo.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Eliminate the exemption of private investment fund carried interest from the NYC unincorporated business tax.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Resolution in support of President Barack Obama’s Second Chance Pell Pilot Program, which will initiate new models to allow incarcerated individuals to receive Pell Grants to finance their education.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 3 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Borelli, Ulrich, and Matteo..



The following Council Member formally abstained to vote on this item:  Council Member Cohen.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Support of President Barack Obama’s Second Chance Pell Pilot Program.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 46 Council Members present at this Stated Meeting.

There is a vacant seat in the Council pending the sweraing-in of the certified winner of the Fenruary 23, 2016 Special Election which was held in the 17th District (The Bronx).

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
